content: The "Criminal Terrorism Improvements Act of 2006" may be cited as the short title for this Act. This Act includes provisions related to terrorist offenses resulting in death. DEATH PENALTY FOR CERTAIN TERROR RELATED CRIMES. The "Criminal Terrorism Improvements Act of 2006" amends various sections of the United States Code to include death penalty provisions for offenses related to nuclear weapons, missile systems, atomic weapons, radiological dispersal devices, and the variola virus. SEC. 4. INCREASE IN PENALTIES: Amends penalties in various sections of title 18, United States Code, increasing from 20 to 30 years and from 10 to 20 years for certain offenses. SEC. 5. MODERNIZATION OF STATE OF MIND REQUIREMENT: Changes the requirement for Section 2339C offenses from "unlawfully and wilfully" to "knowingly." SEC. 6. PROVIDING MATERIAL SUPPORT TO TERRORIST GROUPS. Section 2339C of title 18, United States Code is amended by replacing "unlawfully and wilfully" with "knowingly." Section 2339A(a) is amended to increase penalties for providing material support to terrorists. Section 2339D is also amended to increase penalties for receiving military-type training from a foreign terrorist organization. Additionally, federal benefits are denied to convicted terrorists. SEC. 7 amends Chapter 113B of title 18, United States Code to deny Federal benefits to individuals convicted of Federal crimes of terrorism. This includes ineligibility for any or all Federal benefits for a specified term or for life. The definition of 'Federal benefit' is in accordance with the Controlled Substances Act. SEC. 8 amends Section 2516(q) of title 18, US Code by updating wiretap predicates. SEC. 9 modifies Section 2339D by including attempts or conspiracies related to military training offenses.
